content:
Adding a **Follow-up Status** column will help you effectively manage your follow-ups and stay on top of your networking efforts.

**Updated People Met sheet:**

| Name | Title/Company | Contact Info | Conversation Notes | Follow-up Action | Follow-up Deadline | Follow-up Status | Industry/Sector | Event |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Rachel | [unknown] Google | [rachel.google.com](mailto:rachel.google.com) | Discussed intent-based marketing | Send follow-up email | 2023-02-24 | Pending | Technology > Internet | Marketing Conference at Hilton Hotel |

You can use the following follow-up status categories:

* **Pending**: The follow-up action is scheduled or waiting to be completed.
* **Completed**: The follow-up action has been taken, and the outcome is known (e.g., response received, meeting scheduled, etc.).
* **Rejected**: The follow-up action was declined or rejected (e.g., email bounced back, person not interested, etc.).
* **On Hold**: The follow-up action is delayed or put on hold due to various reasons (e.g., person out of office, waiting for additional information, etc.).

By tracking the follow-up status, you'll be able to:

1. Easily identify which follow-ups are pending and need attention.
2. Celebrate your successes by marking follow-ups as completed.
3. Learn from rejections and adjust your approach for future follow-ups.
4. Manage your time more effectively by prioritizing follow-ups based on their status.

**Tips for using the Follow-up Status column:**

1. Update the status regularly: As you complete or receive responses to your follow-ups, update the status accordingly.
2. Use filters and sorting: Filter the sheet by follow-up status to focus on pending or completed actions, and sort by deadline to prioritize your next steps.
3. Set reminders: Set reminders for follow-up deadlines to ensure you don't miss important next steps.
4. Analyze your follow-up success: Review your follow-up status data to identify patterns or areas for improvement in your networking strategy.

By incorporating the Follow-up Status column, you'll be able to streamline your follow-up process, increase your productivity, and make the most of your networking efforts!
